          boolean treat_non_html_as_error
          If a Tuple is not HTML whether to send it to the status stream as an error or pass it on the default stream

        • maxLengthCharsetDetection

          int maxLengthCharsetDetection
          Length of content to use for detecting the charset. Set to -1 to use the full content (will make the parser slow), 0 to deactivate the detection altogether, or any other value (at least a few hundred bytes).

        • perSecMetrics

          org.apache.storm.metric.api.MultiReducedMetric perSecMetrics

        • protocolFactory

          ProtocolFactory protocolFactory

        • taskID

          int taskID

        • sitemapsAutoDiscovery

          boolean sitemapsAutoDiscovery

          com.google.common.cache.Cache<K,V> throttler

        • queueMode

          String queueMode

        • crawlDelay

          long crawlDelay
          default crawl delay in msec, can be overridden by robots directives

        • maxCrawlDelay

          long maxCrawlDelay
          max value accepted from robots.txt

        • maxCrawlDelayForce

          boolean maxCrawlDelayForce
          whether to enforce the configured max. delay, or to skip URLs from queues with overlong crawl-delay

        • crawlDelayForce

          boolean crawlDelayForce
          whether the default delay is used even if the robots.txt specifies a shorter crawl-delay

        • activeThreads

          AtomicInteger activeThreads

        • maxThrottleSleepMSec

          long maxThrottleSleepMSec
          Amount of time the bolt will sleep to enfore politeness, if the time needed to wait is above it, the tuple is sent back to the Storm internal queue. Deactivate by default i.e. nothing is sent back to the bolt via the throttle stream.

        • protocolMDprefix

          String protocolMDprefix

          AtomicBoolean isInQuery

        • queryTimes

          CollectionMetric queryTimes

        • beingProcessed

          AbstractQueryingSpout.InProcessMap<K,V> beingProcessed
          Map to keep in-process URLs, with the URL as key and optional value depending on the spout implementation. The entries are kept in a cache for a configurable amount of time to avoid that some items are fetched a second time if new items are queried shortly after they have been acked.

        • active

          boolean active
